com.defano.jmonet.canvas

Class AbstractPaintCanvas

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JScrollPane
            • com.defano.jmonet.canvas.surface.AbstractScrollableSurface
              • com.defano.jmonet.canvas.AbstractPaintCanvas
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ObservableSurface, PaintCanvas, CompositeSurface, ScalableLayeredPainting, Scrollable, ComponentListener, ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable, EventListener, Accessible, ScrollPaneConstants
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    JMonetCanvas

    public abstract class AbstractPaintCanvas
extends AbstractScrollableSurface
implements PaintCanvas, ComponentListener
    A scrollable, Swing component that can be painted upon using the paint tools in com.defano.jmonet.tools. See JMonetCanvas for a canvas with an undo/redo buffer.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Marks this component safe for garbage collection; removes registered listeners and components.

      • setSize

        public void setSize(int width,
                    int height)
        Sets the size of the canvas component (i.e., the size of the paintable image not including any scale). As such, the size of the canvas will not match necessarily match the size of the image returned by PaintCanvas.getCanvasImage() when the scale factor is a value other than 1.0.
        Specified by:
        setSize in interface PaintCanvas
        Overrides:
        setSize in class Component
        Parameters:
        width - The desired width of the paintable image
        height - The desired height of the paintable image

      • convertPointToImage

        public Point convertPointToImage(Point p)
        Converts a scaled, surface coordinate to a canvas coordinate and snaps the resulting coordinate to the nearest grid coordinate. When no scale and no grid has been applied (i.e., scale = 1.0, grid = 1) then the output of this function is the same as its input. When a scale factor has been applied, then the input coordinates are divided by the scale factor. When a grid factor has been applied, the result of de-scaling the input is then rounded to nearest grid spacing factor.
        Specified by:
        convertPointToImage in interface ScalableLayeredPainting
        Parameters:
        p - A point in scaled, surface space
        Returns:
        The equivalent point in terms of the canvas image.

      • getScratchImage

        public BufferedImage getScratchImage()
        Gets the "scratch" image associated with this drawable. The "scratch" image is a temporary buffer allowing tools to draw on the canvas in a way that doesn't affect the underlying graphic.
        Specified by:
        getScratchImage in interface PaintCanvas
        Returns:
        The scratch buffer image.

      • setScratchImage

        public void setScratchImage(BufferedImage image)
        Sets the contents of the scratch buffer to the provided image.
        Specified by:
        setScratchImage in interface PaintCanvas
        Parameters:
        image - The image that should replace the contents of the current scratch buffer.

      • commit

        public void commit()
        Commits the contents of the scratch buffer to the canvas, using the AlphaComposite.SRC_OVER composite mode.
        Specified by:
        commit in interface PaintCanvas

      • setScale

        public void setScale(double scale)
        Sets the scale factor of the canvas. Values greater than 1 result in the canvas image appearing enlarged; values less than 1 result in the canvas image appearing shrunken.
        Specified by:
        setScale in interface PaintCanvas
        Parameters:
        scale - The scale factor
